item.title: Report E-2024120071
item.description:
Report E-2024120071

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-09T12:25:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: JANESVILLE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 4, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint were punctured in transit and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all waste into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120073
item.description:
Report E-2024120073

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-09T12:25:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: UTRECHT
  • State:
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING THE PRE-LOAD OPERATIONS AT THE UPS UTRECHT FACILITY IN THE NETHERLANDS ONE PACKAGE FELT WARM TO THE TOUCH AND SHOWED SIGNS OF SMOKE. THE PACKAGE WAS IMMEDIATELY REMOVED FROM THE BUILDING AND SECURED. THERE WERE NO VISIBLE FLAMES OBSERVED. DURING INNER CONTENT INSPECTION THERE IS EVIDENCE OF BURNING, MELTING, AND CHARRING OF THE INNER CONTENTS. THE INCIDENT PACKAGE WAS MARKED AND LABELLED AS UN3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES, SECTION IA OF PACKING INSTRUCTION 965 WITH A CARGO AIRCRAFT ONLY AND CLASS 9 LITHIUM BATTERY LABEL. THE PACKAGE WAS PART OF A THREE PACKAGE SHIPMENT WITH AN APPROPRIATE IATA SHIPPERS DECLARATION AND HAD PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT IN HONG KONG ON 15-NOV-2024. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM HKG - SHJ - CGN BEFORE EXPERIENCING THE THERMAL EVENT IN UTRECHT, NETHERLANDS. THERE ARE TWO ADDITIONAL PACKAGES IN THE SHIPMENT THAT WERE ALSO REMOVED AND SECURED, TRACKING NUMBERS 1Z802E150499401436 AND 1Z802E150495846446. THESE TWO PACKAGES WERE NOT INVOLVED IN THE LITHIUM BATTERY EVENT. THE PACKAGE WAS REPORTED TO THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER ON 04-DEC-2024, REPORT NUMBER 1417932.

item.title: Report E-2024120074
item.description:
Report E-2024120074

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-09T12:25:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: COLONIAL HEIGHTS
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 4, 2024, four (4) 2.5-gallon jugs of UN3265 were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior, dock floor, and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized neutralizing agents, absorbents and hand tools to collect the spent product. All waste was containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect and containerize all waste in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024120416
item.description:
Report X-2024120416

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-09T12:25:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-29
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE GROUND TO ALASKA PACKAGE HAD SHIPPED FROM COLORADO TO ALASKA WAS AT THE DESTINATION IN ALASKA WHEN THE DRIVER SMELLED A STRONG FUEL ODOR.THE DRIVER ALSO DISCOVERED THE PACKAGE HAD LEAKED IN THE DELIVERY TRUCK. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE HONDA EU1000I PORTABLE INVERTER GENERATOR WITH FUEL IN THE TANK. THE FUEL WAS SLOSHING AROUND CAUSING THE GENERATOR TO LEAK FROM THE CLOSURE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM COLORADO USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 50X763, THE UPS STORE, 3531 S LOGAN ST, ENGLEWOOD CO 80113-3700. PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED DISCOVERY THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN FROM ONT TO ANC.

item.title: Report E-2024120068
item.description:
Report E-2024120068

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-09T12:25:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-13
  • City: DUBAI
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING X-RAY SCREENING IN DUBAI, UNITED ARAB EMIRATES, TWO AIR PACKAGES FROM USA TO EGYPT WERE FOUND TO CONTAIN AEROSOL PRODUCTS THAT ARE REGULATED IN TRANSPORTATION. PACKAGE TRACKING NUMBER 1Z24E0636741898271 CONTAINS TWO INNER BOXES EACH WITH TWELVE FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CANS OF CANTESCO ZINC GALV SPRAY. THE INNER TWO BOXES CONTAINING THE AEROSOL PRODUCTS ARE PREPRINTED WITH GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. PACKAGE TRACKING NUMBER 1Z24E0636742217487 CONTAINS TWELVE FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CANS OF CANTESCO SOLVENT CLEANER, TWELVE FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CANS OF CANTESCO ZINC GALV SPRAY, AND TWELVE NON-FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CANS OF CANTESCO WATER BASED ANTI-SPLATTER. THESE INNER BOXES ARE ALSO PREPRINTED WITH GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON EITHER OF THE OUTERMOST FIBERBOARD BOXES.

item.title: Report E-2024120047
item.description:
Report E-2024120047

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-09T12:25:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-12
  • City: CHEYENNE
  • State: WY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PIONEER TANK LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The drivers left the shippers facility enroute to the final destination. Upon entering highway traffic, the driver encountered vehicles that were not merging correctly and driving aggressively. They brake checked each other and the truck driver had to do emergency braking maneuver to avoid collision with the 2 other vehicles. The load shifted forward, and 2 IBCs shifted and pushed barrels together after the load securement failed. The drum of ferric chloride was crushed by one of the other barrels, causing a crack at the bottom corner of the barrel. The duration of the release was approximately 1.5 hours. The local fire department was called and was on scene along with WY DOT personnel as it happened at the Wyoming Port of Entry. The Laramie County fire department had sand delivered and built a berm and used absorbent to stop the spread of the spill. Clean Harbors was contacted by the company to handle the remediation. The fire department left the scene once the leak stopped and Clean Harbors was enroute from Denver, CO. Clean Harbors unloaded the trailer in order to find the compromised drum, which was put into a 95-gallon overpack to contain and neutralize it with soda ash. The crew then decontaminated the trailer using a mix of water and speedy dry. All waste associated with the decontamination was then shoveled and wiped into a 55-gallon poly drum which was picked up the following day.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSJ experienced a UN1760 2204 Descaler-Acid Pickle release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-teaspoon of product released to a 1 x 1 area of the poly tote lid due to a crack in the top of the tote. The material was gravity fed from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with absorbents and PPE into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

  • Description: On December 4, 2024, nine (9) 5-gallon pails of paint thinner were crushed in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted waste and the damaged pails were containerized in five (5) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • City: MONTGOMERY

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XNW experienced a UN2920 Dicoco Dimethyl Ammonium Chloride release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4 ounces of product released to a 1 x 1 area of the poly tote lid due to a loose cap. The cap was tightened and re-secured onto the tote. The tote was then decontaminated, wiped down, and secured for continued shipment on. The impacted pads used to clean the tote were containerized into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024120055
item.description:
Report E-2024120055

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to the drum being punctured by a nail when a skid was broken at the terminal. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized it and the PM solvent into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum. Addition PM solvent was containerized in one (1) 65-gallon medal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: On December 3, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1760 were crushed in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and surrounding freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized neutralizers, absorbents, and hand tools to remove any product. All waste and the damaged pails were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately three (3) gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails being crushed. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 6-gallon poly drums for waste and recovery. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM PENNSYLVANIA, USA USING UPS ACCOUNT 834WR3, E-PARCEL INDIA, NO 6, JOSEPH LANE, COLOMBO SRI LANKA 00400.

  • Description: THE WET PACKAGE WAS FOUND IN THE INSIDE SOUTH INDUCT IN SMALLS AT 20:54 ON 11/13/24. AFTER OPENING THE PACKAGE IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE BOX WAS ONLY EXTERNALLY AFFECTED BY A LIQUID. NONE OF THE PACKAGE CONTENTS WERE DAMAGED/LEAKING. HOWEVER, IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE PACKAGE CONTAINED AN AEROSOL CAN AND WAS NOT AFFIXED WITH ANY OUTWARD HAZARD COMMUNICATIONS. THE INCIDENT WAS REPORTED TO RMP AS A SUSPECTED UNDECLARED HAZMAT. PACKAGE WILL BE HELD FOR ADG COMPLIANCE.

Terminal place impacted product, oil dry and rags into (1) 10-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report E-2024120060
item.description:
Report E-2024120060

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2152 ET, Carla Paul with XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XHG. It was reported that approximately 25-gallons of Dibromo-3-NITRILOPROPION AMIDE released from a plastic drum due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted inside of trailer #3117679 and asphalt. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. A contractor was dispatched and observed an estimated release of 20-gallons onto the wooden trailer floor in a 10x5 area and the concrete beneath the trailer in a 20x5 area. The contractor neutralized the release soda ash and absorbed the spill with oil dry. The damaged drum was overpacked into an 85-gallon DF. The neutralized impacted absorbents and pallet pieces were containerized into two 55-gallon DFs. All waste generated was left on-site for XPO to manage. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

The spill was contained to the ULD and floor of the warehouse. The affected area was closed off and cleaned in house. The internal packaging led to the leakage. The contributing factors were inner packaging material, temperature regulation, transportation towards the warehouse, and the actual slack composition/construction itself.

  • Description: Pkg missing required markings for shipment containing hazardous contents. 1 x 24 oz. bottle of Hand Sanitizer 70% has a Flash point of 25-27 C (77-80.6 F) and typically ships as "Ltd Qty". Loose and missing trigger spray heads of non-hazardous liquid contents allowed liquid to leak wetting and damaging the contents and carton. Excessive weight of the contents and weakening from the leaked liquid caused the corner of the carton to rip and glue to fail on the closure tape.

item.description:
Report E-2024120031

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-03
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 3, 2024, one (1) 55-gallond drum of printing ink was damaged and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Coastal Environmental Solutions (CES) to remediate the impacted site. CES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the ink-impacted trailer floor. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon overpack and all impacted waste and absorbents collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon pail.

item.title: Report E-2024120020
item.description:
Report E-2024120020

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-03
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 15-gallon drum containing hazardous product, Nalco Stabrex#ST70. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 0.5-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 2'x2' area as a result of improper loading/inadequate preparation for transportation. The contractor used sodium bicarbonate to neutralize the release and applied oil dry to clean-up the spill. The damaged drum was overpacked into one 55-gallon DF for waste disposal. The neutralized and impacted oil dry was containerized into a separate 55-gallon DF for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste generated from the spill response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

The spilled jerrican was placed in a salvage drum and the entire shipment is being held, awaiting an amended Shipper's Declaration for further transport.

  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN CASABLANCA, MOROCCO ONE AIR PACKAGE FROM NETHERLANDS TO MOROCCO WAS FOUND TO CONTAIN MULTIPLE CELL PHONES. THE THERMAL TRACKING LABEL AND INVOICE DESCRIBES CONTENTS AS SMARTPHONES. THE OUTER PACKAGE IS INTACT WITHOUT ANY TRACES OF DAMAGES. CUSTOMS AUTHORITIES IN MOROCCO WILL ONLY PROVIDE X-RAY PHOTOS OF THE PACKAGE CONTENTS TO UPS. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM NETHERLANDS USING UPS ACCOUNT FA5120, CHEAP CARGO, TAKENHOFPLEIN 1, NIJMEGEN, 6537SZ NETHERLANDS.

item.title: Report E-2024120021
item.description:
Report E-2024120021

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-26
  • City: NORTH HUNTINGDON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0326 ET, Kevin Boswell with XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XPB. It was reported that approximately 0.5-cups of Unisol Liquid Red BK-50 released from a tote due to a packaging defect. The release impacted concrete dock floor. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-inch of residual product released. The shipper was contacted who stated the 1-inch residual was okay to ship back. The contactor secured the leaking valve as much as possible after draining the remaining material out of the valve and relayed most of the residual product out of the tote and secured the damaged valve for it to be transported back to the shipper. The contractor confirmed there was no waste generated from the tote transfer.

item.title: Report I-2024120006
item.description:
Report I-2024120006

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-17
  • City: Knoxville
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GRAMMER INDUSTRIES INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While doing a routine inspection at TruckStop, a leak was discovered coming from the bottom gasket on tank truck. A slow drip of product was detected on the asphalt surface beneath truck. Less than 6 ounces of nitric acid were released and contained to immediate area. Marion Environmental was dispatched to assess site. Upon arrival on site, Marion Environmental tightened the bolts on Leaking gasket which stopped the release. Absorbent material was applied to the affected asphalt, which was worked in and recovered into one 55-gallon drum. The truck was. Monitored overnight without further incident and then sent on to its destination. There were no injuries or exposures reported

Further investigation discovered that a protruding nail on the pallet the drum was staged on had punctured the bottom of the drum consequently contributing to the unintentional release. item.title: Report E-2024120026
item.description:
Report E-2024120026

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-06
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 11:21 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XKC) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a forklift incident, approximately .25 gallon of Conquest (hazardous - UN1824) was released and is no longer leaking. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, damaged drum, and oil-dri will be placed into an 85-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. There is no regulatory reporting required for this release. ERTS will upload the BOL, SDS and create a waste container entry. ERTS contacted Charles (Chemtrec) who provided report #2024110600102. ERTS contacted the terminal to get dispatch for cleanup, but the caller advised they already cleaned and contained the release.

  • Description: At 0726 ET, XPO terminal XKC notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 8 ounces of UN2794 released from wet filled battery due to improper loading and tipping over during transit. The release impacted trailer # 3214774. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The terminal used a 5-Gallon poly drum for the waste. The battery will continue on to the consignee.

item.title: Report I-2024120005
item.description:
Report I-2024120005

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-23
  • City: Townville
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: THE WHITAKER COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6365
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver after crossing a rough portion of I-85 noticed a mist in his mirror. He subsequently stopped as soon as possible pulling off the roadway, and off the shoulder as well to investigate. Noticed product Leaking from the rear of his trailer(approx 1/2 gal per min). He placed the absorbent pads he had, to catch what he could and notified his supervisor. His supervisor immediately notified TWC regulatory dept. We then determined what was Leaking and reached out to our response company whom notified DHEC and located a company who could respond. We decided to send personnel from our Spartanburg facility with more pads and catch containers. They arrived before the response company and were able to move some material around on the trailer and where able to close the valve on the IBC and re-secure the dust cap on the tote. They then started using pads to absorb what product they could, as DHEC and the Response company arrived. They then took over assessing the impact and cleanup of the lost material.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 27, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3149 was damaged and released five (5) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew performed a tote transfer and remediated the impacted site with absorbents and hand tools. Two (2) 55-gallon drums of waste were staged onsite.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-04T12:24:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-26
  • City: ABERDEEN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THREE AIR PACKAGES WERE INSPECTED DUE TO THE SOUND OF DRY ICE PELLETS ROLLING AROUND IN THE BOXES. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EACH PACKAGE CONTAINS APPROXIMATELY THREE POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING CHEESE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. OUTER BOXES ARE THERMO CHILL INSULATED SHIPPER PACKAGES PREPRINTED PERISHABLE. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO THE SAME CONSIGNEE IS 1Z096P9X0164643560 AND 1Z096R9X0164662861. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 096R9X, THE UPS STORE, 1013 BEARDS HILL RD 101-M, ABERDEEN MD 21001-2295.

item.title: Report X-2024120037
item.description:
Report X-2024120037

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-04T12:24:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-26
  • City: WINDSOR
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11/26/2024 at approximately 1445, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4652518 at the station location in Ontario, reporting undeclared hazardous materials. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box containing one glass jar, containing a clear liquid. The shipment's commodity description was "bunker fuel". Using an online safety data sheet, Dangerous Goods Administration classified the bunker fuel as UN1268 Petroleum distillates. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA regulations, as it did not display the required markings, labeling, packaging or paperwork. The shipment is being held for an FAA investigation.

  • Description: On November 26, 2024, four (4) 1-gallon pails of UN3149 were damaged and released approximately three (3) gallons to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the site. TWE utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.description:
Report E-2024120010

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-04T12:24:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-25
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of Acetone was released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improperly loaded freight. The release impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area. The granular absorbents and spent material were placed in one (1) 5-gallon poly drum, while the original container was placed in one (1) 10-gallon drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120002
item.description:
Report E-2024120002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-04T12:24:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-05
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1811 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at XEJ. It was reported that approximately 20 gallons of Americo AMB-5147 released from a 270-gallon plastic tote due to improper loading by XEJ. The tote was punctured by the side of the trailer. The release impacted trailer #3117704 at dock door 38. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 75-gallons of UN3264 Americo AMB-5147 product released to a 12 x 8.5 area of the trailer floor due to impacted by sharp protruding object within the trailer. Contractors neutralized area with sodium bicarbonate and transferred material to new tote. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with impacted absorbents into (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 0522 ET, BCH notified ERTS of a cargo release inside trailer #3115104. It was reported 5-gallon of Gray Suede paint released from 8 5-gallon metal cans. The cargo was reported to be crushed during transit. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined terminal personnel can clean the release with PPE on site. The caller reported it will be absorbed with oil dri and placed into an 85-gallon metal drum.

Another passenger bumped their head while evacuating and was also treated at the scene. No hospitalizations were needed.

item.title: Report I-2024110018
item.description:
Report I-2024110018

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-03T09:15:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-05
  • City: REYDON
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PLAINS MARKETING GP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 148200
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On October 5, 2024, at approximately 12:30 p.m in Roger Mills County, Oklahoma, a Plains transport driver with a load of crude oil traveling westbound on Oklahoma Highway 47 departed the roadway. The driver attempted to re-enter the roadway, causing both truck and cargo to roll 1 1/4 times before reentering the roadway where it overturned. The driver was found deceased on the scene. Upon investigation, the front ladder of the cargo trailer had punctured a hole in the trailer at the 7 o'clock position (11 o'clock position upright). As a result of the rollover, approximately 140 barrels of crude oil were released into the dry roadside ditch. The vehicle was removed from the scene, and impacted soils were excavated and removed in accordance with the Oklahoma Corporation Commission Oil & Gas Division clean-up criteria.
